segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Katherine.
And today we've got an upper intermediate level lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节中高级水平的课程。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to go and buy shoes.
Okay, this is very fun.
I like buying shoes, although I have a hard time finding shoes in my size sometimes.
segments.cn: 我喜欢买鞋子，尽管有时我很难找到合适我尺码的鞋子。

segments.en: But we're here talking about men's shoes specifically.
segments.cn: 但我们今天专门讨论男鞋。

segments.en: That's right, we've actually decided to talk about this topic, buying shoes separately between men and women's shoes because I think each type of shoe has its own type of vocab and that can be very useful for men or women.
segments.cn: 没错，我们决定分别讨论男鞋和女鞋，因为我认为每种鞋子都有其特定的词汇，这对男士或女士都很有用。

segments.en: That's right.
So let's take a listen to today's dialogue and we'll be back in a moment to talk more about the specifics of men's shoe styles.
segments.cn: 那么让我们来听今天的对话，稍后我们会回来讨论男鞋款式的具体细节。

segments.en: Hi, I'm looking for a pair of shoes for my son.
segments.cn: 嗨，我在为我儿子找一双鞋子。

segments.en: Sure thing.
Here we are.
If you're looking for dress shoes, we have several different styles of Oxford for boys.
segments.cn: 如果你在找正装鞋，我们有几种不同款式的男士牛津鞋。

segments.en: We also carry athletic shoes, hiking boots.
segments.cn: 我们也有运动鞋和登山靴。

segments.en: Oh, Jacob, how about these sneakers?
Mom, they've got velcro.
Well, then how about these?
What is this style called?
They're tennis shoes.
They're very popular with teens and young adults.
segments.cn: 这在青少年和年轻人中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Oh, mom, can I get these?
segments.cn: 哦，妈妈，我可以要这双吗？

segments.en: What are those?
They're Chuck Taylors.
Everyone has them.
Can I please?
I don't know.
Would they go with your clothes?
segments.cn: 它们和你的衣服搭配吗？

segments.en: The backs are really high and the way the tongue just sticks up, they're almost like a boot and the sole doesn't look like it would have a very good grip.
segments.cn: 后面很高，舌头的设计几乎像靴子，鞋底看起来抓地力不太好。

segments.en: They're only $45 and they've got cool fluorescent orange shoelaces.
segments.cn: 它们只要45美元，还有酷炫的荧光橙色鞋带。

segments.en: Mom!
Mom!
Okay, try them on.
What size are your feet?
He is a size nine.
We'll try a size 43 on you first and see how that fits.
segments.cn: 我们先试试43码，看看合不合适。

segments.en: A what?
They come in European sizes.
He should be a size 43.
I'll be right back.
All right, we're back.
So, as you saw, we have a lot of different shoe styles and so we're gonna take a look at these on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 如你所见，我们有很多不同的鞋款，所以我们将在Language Takeaway中看看这些。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Okay, first up, we have a very popular style of shoe.
segments.cn: 好的，首先，我们有一种非常受欢迎的鞋款。

segments.en: This is called an athletic shoe.
Okay, athletic shoe.
Now, I imagine that athletes wear these shoes.
segments.cn: 我想运动员会穿这种鞋。

segments.en: Good guess, Marco.
So, athletic athletes.
This is actually for sports in general.
segments.cn: 这实际上是指一般的运动。

segments.en: So, this is sports shoes, but in English we say athletic shoes.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是运动鞋，但在英语中我们称之为运动鞋。

segments.en: Okay, so it's not specifically for any type of sport, but they're just comfortable shoes that you can do most sports in.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它并不特指任何一种运动，而是你可以进行大多数运动的舒适鞋。

segments.en: Right, like running shoes and basketball shoes and soccer shoes.
segments.cn: 对，比如跑鞋、篮球鞋和足球鞋。

segments.en: These are all kinds of athletic shoes.
Very good.
Okay, so these types of athletic shoes, they're usually... they're kind of low, right?
segments.cn: 好的，这些运动鞋通常是... 它们有点低，对吧？

segments.en: They don't have a lot of support around the ankle.
segments.cn: 它们在脚踝周围没有太多支撑。

segments.en: No, but they do have a lot of support in the heel, the bottom of your foot.
segments.cn: 不过它们在脚跟和脚底有很多支撑。

segments.en: Right, because you're running, you need that extra support.
segments.cn: 对，因为你在跑步，你需要额外的支撑。

segments.en: Exactly.
Now, on the opposite, if you're going hiking, if you're maybe trekking, then you need a special type of shoe that's gonna give more ankle support and these are called hiking boots.
segments.cn: 现在，相反，如果你去远足，或者徒步旅行，你需要一种特殊的鞋子，能够提供更多的脚踝支撑，这种鞋叫做登山靴。

segments.en: Okay, hiking boots.
So, like you were saying, you get a lot of support in your ankle, that's the back of your foot and the area around your leg.
segments.cn: 就像你说的，你在脚踝得到很多支撑，那是脚的后面和腿周围的区域。

segments.en: So, these shoes tend to come higher on your leg.
segments.cn: 所以，这些鞋子通常在腿部更高。

segments.en: They're taller on your leg and they're usually pretty heavy.
segments.cn: 它们在腿部更高，通常也比较重。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah, and I think they are more weather resistant.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为它们更耐天气。

segments.en: So, if it rains or if it's wet, these shoes will respond better.
segments.cn: 所以，如果下雨或潮湿，这些鞋子会表现得更好。

segments.en: You're not gonna get wet feet.
You're not, yeah.
And so, hiking boots.
And now, we have another interesting word.
segments.cn: 现在，我们有另一个有趣的词。

segments.en: I never really understood why they're called this way, but we have sneakers.
segments.cn: 我从来不明白为什么它们叫这个，但我们有运动鞋。

segments.en: Sneakers.
Okay, I love sneakers.
I always wear sneakers.
A very common brand that you see with sneakers is Puma.
segments.cn: 运动鞋中非常常见的品牌是Puma。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Also Adidas.
Right.
So, Converse is another brand.
Sneakers are shoes that are not fancy.
segments.cn: 运动鞋是那些不华丽的鞋。

segments.en: They're not like leather or work shoes, but they're also not athletic shoes because you don't necessarily use them when you're playing sports.
segments.cn: 它们不像皮鞋或工作鞋，但也不是运动鞋，因为你不一定在运动时穿它们。

segments.en: They're basically very simple shoes for, you know, normal daily stuff.
segments.cn: 它们基本上是非常简单的鞋，适合日常穿着。

segments.en: Normal walking.
Young people wear them, usually.
Okay, sneakers.
Now, I never understood why they're called sneakers because I think if you sneak maybe on someone, I guess these shoes are good for sneaking up.
segments.cn: 现在，我从来不明白为什么它们叫运动鞋，因为我觉得如果你偷偷接近某人，我想这些鞋子适合悄悄接近。

segments.en: Perhaps.
I don't know.
They're less noisy than other shoes.
segments.cn: 它们比其他鞋子更安静。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
Okay, so we have sneakers.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们有运动鞋。

segments.en: And now, another type of shoe that can be a little bit confusing, they're called tennis shoes.
segments.cn: 现在，还有另一种鞋子可能有点混淆，它们叫做网球鞋。

segments.en: Okay, tennis shoes can be considered a kind of sneaker.
segments.cn: 好的，网球鞋可以被视为一种运动鞋。

segments.en: Again, it's not the kind of shoe that you would normally wear to work.
segments.cn: 再次强调，这不是你通常会穿去工作的鞋。

segments.en: It's not leather.
It's not a hiking boot.
They're low shoes, so low ankles, generally.
segments.cn: 它们是低帮鞋，通常是低脚踝的。

segments.en: And they have, they tie up, you know.
segments.cn: 而且它们是系带的，你知道的。

segments.en: Right.
But it's, you would think that you use these shoes to play tennis.
segments.cn: 但你会认为这些鞋子是用来打网球的。

segments.en: Not necessarily.
But not necessarily, right?
I mean, you don't have to play tennis.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，你不必打网球。

segments.en: Oh, they're not specifically designed to play tennis.
segments.cn: 哦，它们并不是专门设计用来打网球的。

segments.en: Now, perhaps originally they were tennis shoes for the game tennis, but nowadays they're very, very common.
segments.cn: 现在，也许最初它们是为打网球而设计的鞋子，但现在它们非常普遍。

segments.en: They're like sneakers.
Right.
They're shoes that most young people wear to school or to play around in.
segments.cn: 这是大多数年轻人上学或玩耍时穿的鞋子。

segments.en: Okay, so they're kind of a, yeah, like you say, a sneaker.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以它们有点像，你说的，运动鞋。

segments.en: And now moving on, these might seem a little bit strange, but we call them Chuck Taylors.
segments.cn: 现在继续，这些可能看起来有点奇怪，但我们称它们为查克·泰勒。

segments.en: Chuck Taylors?
Well, basically Chuck Taylor is a brand.
segments.cn: 嗯，基本上查克·泰勒是一个品牌。

segments.en: Okay.
Converse Chuck Taylors.
We also call them Chucks.
And this is a style of shoe that this brand made very famous.
segments.cn: 这是这个品牌非常著名的一种鞋款。

segments.en: They're very, very thin canvas shoes.
segments.cn: 它们是非常薄的帆布鞋。

segments.en: So the fabric is not leather, it's canvas.
segments.cn: 所以面料不是皮革，而是帆布。

segments.en: Okay.
And they come in bright red or black or green.
segments.cn: 它们有鲜红色、黑色或绿色。

segments.en: Yeah.
And some of them are very low and some of them have a ankle, a piece of the ankle that comes up.
segments.cn: 有些非常低，有些则有一段脚踝的部分。

segments.en: So it almost looks like a, like a, like a boot to a certain extent, but it's not like a hiking boot.
segments.cn: 所以它看起来几乎像靴子，但并不是登山靴。

segments.en: It's not very hard.
It doesn't support your ankle as much as just the style is higher.
segments.cn: 它对脚踝的支撑没有那么多，只是样式更高。

segments.en: Exactly.
And so because these are made of fabric, they're very thin, they're very light.
segments.cn: 因为这些是用面料制成的，所以它们非常薄，非常轻。

segments.en: They're not very good for hiking, for example.
segments.cn: 例如，它们并不适合远足。

segments.en: Right.
So these are called Chuck Taylors.
segments.cn: 所以这些被称为查克·泰勒。

segments.en: They're very, very popular with teenagers, right?
segments.cn: 它们在青少年中非常受欢迎，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
Teenagers all over the world wear Chuck Taylors.
segments.cn: 世界各地的青少年都穿查克·泰勒。

segments.en: And I think they're very old.
segments.cn: 我认为它们已经很久了。

segments.en: This style, these Chuck Taylors have been around for like 30 years.
segments.cn: 这种风格的查克·泰勒已经存在大约30年了。

segments.en: I think since the 1960s or 70s.
segments.cn: 我想自1960年代或70年代以来。

segments.en: But they're still popular.
Yeah.
And they haven't changed.
They haven't changed.
Right.
So these are the five types or styles of shoes that we're going to take a look at.
segments.cn: 所以这些是我们要看看五种类型或风格的鞋子。

segments.en: Why don't we move on now to more specific vocab related to the parts of the shoe on Language Takeaway, part two.
segments.cn: 现在我们为什么不继续讨论与鞋子部件相关的更具体的词汇，语言要点第二部分。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Okay, so Jacob is talking to his mother and his mom wants to know, hey, how about these sneakers?
segments.cn: 好吧，雅各布正在和他的母亲交谈，他的妈妈想知道，嘿，这些运动鞋怎么样？

segments.en: What do you think?
And Jacob says, Mom, they've got Velcro.
segments.cn: 雅各布说，妈妈，它们有魔术贴。

segments.en: Okay.
So Marco, what's this Velcro Jacob speaks of?
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，雅各布所说的魔术贴是什么？

segments.en: Well, as you can see, Velcro is capitalized, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所看到的，魔术贴是大写的，对吧？

segments.en: And so that means this is a proper noun.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着这是一个专有名词。

segments.en: And it's actually a brand.
Okay, it's like Chuck Taylors.
Like Chuck Taylors.
So Velcro is supposed kind of like a like a zipper, right?
segments.cn: 所以魔术贴有点像拉链，对吧？

segments.en: A fastener, but instead of zipping it up, you just put two pieces of cloth together and they stick.
segments.cn: 一种扣件，但不是拉上，而是把两块布放在一起，它们就粘在一起。

segments.en: Okay, and when you pull them apart, they make that sound.
segments.cn: 好的，当你把它们分开时，它们会发出那种声音。

segments.en: Yeah, they make a loud sound.
segments.cn: 是的，它们会发出很大的声音。

segments.en: And so sometimes with baby shoes or young children's shoes, we don't want to tie them because that's too hard.
segments.cn: 所以有时对于婴儿鞋或幼儿鞋，我们不想系鞋带，因为那太难了。

segments.en: So we have Velcro.
This is a kind of fabric, like you said, that sticks together.
segments.cn: 这是一种布料，正如你所说，能够粘在一起。

segments.en: We don't have to spend all this time tying things.
segments.cn: 我们不必花那么多时间系东西。

segments.en: So you see Velcro on hats, on gloves, on jackets, on shoes.
segments.cn: 所以你会在帽子、手套、夹克、鞋子上看到魔术贴。

segments.en: It's a very popular way to make things, close things or to keep things secure.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常流行的方式来关闭或固定东西。

segments.en: In a very easy way, right?
segments.cn: 以一种非常简单的方式，对吧？

segments.en: You just push them together and that's it.
segments.cn: 你只需把它们推在一起，就可以了。

segments.en: They're sealed.
Exactly.
So the next time you see it, now you know that it's called Velcro.
segments.cn: 所以下次你看到它时，现在你知道它叫魔术贴。

segments.en: I imagine in other languages, it's probably called the same thing.
segments.cn: 我想在其他语言中，它可能也叫这个名字。

segments.en: Well, right.
It's the brand name.
Yeah.
Yeah.
So, okay.
And well, now moving on to the parts of the shoe, we have the tongue.
segments.cn: 现在继续到鞋子的部件，我们有鞋舌。

segments.en: Okay, well, think about the body part, the tongue, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，想想身体部位，舌头，对吧？

segments.en: When you look at your tongue, it's straight and it's flat and it kind of curves at the bottom, right?
segments.cn: 当你看着你的舌头时，它是直的、平的，底部有点弯曲，对吧？

segments.en: Well, on a shoe, when you're putting your shoe on, you know, in the front of the shoe can make it stuck, you have to pull the tongue, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，在鞋子上，当你穿鞋时，鞋子的前面可能会卡住，你必须拉动鞋舌，对吧？

segments.en: It's a piece of fabric or piece of the shoe where the top of your foot is.
segments.cn: 它是鞋子的一块布，位于你脚的顶部。

segments.en: Yeah, very good.
So that's called the tongue.
Now, some shoes have a very small tongue or low one and other have a very high one.
segments.cn: 现在，有些鞋子有非常小的鞋舌或低的鞋舌，而其他鞋子则有非常高的鞋舌。

segments.en: Like, for example, Chuck Taylors, they have a big tongue.
segments.cn: 比如说，查克·泰勒，它们有很大的鞋舌。

segments.en: That's right.
Very long tongue.
And so the tongue is the part that rests on top of your foot.
segments.cn: 所以鞋舌是位于你脚顶部的部分。

segments.en: And usually the shoelaces are over the tongue.
Exactly.
And now moving on to the bottom part of the shoe, that's called the sole.
segments.cn: 现在继续到鞋子的底部，称为鞋底。

segments.en: OK, S-O-L-E, sole.
This is a really important part of shoes.
segments.cn: 这是鞋子中非常重要的部分。

segments.en: I always look at the sole before I buy a pair of shoes because this is the part that you use the most because you're walking on the ground.
segments.cn: 我总是在买鞋之前查看鞋底，因为这是你使用最多的部分，因为你在地面上行走。

segments.en: Right.
So, for example, hiking boots, they will have a very high sole and they will have kind of like a pattern so that you don't slip if you're walking on dirt, right?
segments.cn: 例如，登山靴，它们会有非常高的鞋底，并且会有一种图案，以便你在走在泥土上时不会滑倒，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
Sometimes rubber, a rubber sole.
But other times like Chuck Taylors also have a rubber sole, but it's very thin.
segments.cn: 但有时像查克·泰勒也有橡胶鞋底，但它非常薄。

segments.en: It's very thin.
And some shoes, for example, they have a plastic sole maybe because they're used for other purposes.
segments.cn: 有些鞋子，比如，它们可能有塑料鞋底，因为它们用于其他目的。

segments.en: So they might be a little bit slippery if you go on to a smooth surface.
segments.cn: 所以如果你走在光滑的表面上，它们可能会有点滑。

segments.en: Exactly.
So the sole, that's the bottom part of the shoe.
And the last part of the shoe that we're going to take a look at and probably the most important are the shoe laces.
segments.cn: 我们要看的鞋子的最后一个部分，可能是最重要的部分是鞋带。

segments.en: Shoe laces.
So shoelaces are basically long pieces of string that you use to tie your shoes closed.
segments.cn: 鞋带基本上是用来把鞋子系紧的长绳子。

segments.en: Because you want your shoes to be tight on your foot.
segments.cn: 因为你希望鞋子在脚上是紧的。

segments.en: You don't want it to be too loose, otherwise it might fall off.
segments.cn: 你不希望它太松，否则可能会掉下来。

segments.en: Right.
And Chuck Taylors and some other shoes are very famous for having crazy colored laces or for people using crazy colored laces to tie them up.
segments.cn: Chuck Taylors和其他一些鞋子以其疯狂的彩色鞋带而闻名，或者人们用疯狂的彩色鞋带来系鞋。

segments.en: Right.
So that's the part they use to tie or tighten the shoe with.
segments.cn: 所以那是用来系或收紧鞋子的部分。

segments.en: So on the opposite, if a shoe doesn't have shoelaces, it's probably going to have velcro.
segments.cn: 所以相反，如果一双鞋没有鞋带，它可能会有魔术贴。

segments.en: That's right.
Velcro or shoelaces.
Okay.
So those are all the words that we have for you today.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们有的词就是这些。

segments.en: Why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 我们再回去听最后一次对话吧。

segments.en: Hi, I'm looking for a pair of shoes for my son.
segments.cn: 嗨，我在为我儿子找一双鞋。

segments.en: Sure thing.
Here we are.
If you're looking for dress shoes, we have several different styles of Oxford for boys.
segments.cn: 如果你在找正装鞋，我们有几种不同款式的男士牛津鞋。

segments.en: We also carry athletic shoes, hiking boots.
segments.cn: 我们也有运动鞋、登山靴。

segments.en: Oh, Jacob, how about these sneakers?
Mom, they've got velcro.
Well, then how about these?
What is this style called?
They're tennis shoes.
They're very popular with teens and young adults.
segments.cn: 它们在青少年和年轻人中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: Oh, mom, can I get these?
segments.cn: 哦，妈妈，我可以要这双吗？

segments.en: What are those?
They're Chuck Taylors.
Everyone has them.
Can I please?
I don't know.
Would they go with your clothes?
segments.cn: 它们和你的衣服搭配吗？

segments.en: The backs are really high and the way the tongue just sticks up.
segments.cn: 后面很高，舌头的样子也很突出。

segments.en: They're almost like a boot and the sole doesn't look like it would have a very good grip.
segments.cn: 它们几乎像靴子，鞋底看起来抓地力不太好。

segments.en: They're only $45 and they've got cool fluorescent orange shoelaces.
segments.cn: 只要45美元，还有酷炫的荧光橙色鞋带。

segments.en: Mom!
Mom!
Okay, try them on.
What size are your feet?
He's a size nine.
We'll try a size 43 on you first and see how that fits.
segments.cn: 我们先给你试43码，看看合不合适。

segments.en: A what?
They come in European sizes.
He should be a size 43.
I'll be right back.
All right, so talking about shoes, you say that you always take a look at the sole.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到鞋子，你说你总是会看看鞋底。

segments.en: Why is this?
Because I... I'm always afraid that my shoes are gonna wear out.
segments.cn: 因为我... 我总是担心我的鞋子会磨损。

segments.en: And I don't buy shoes very often.
I love sneakers.
I love my pumas and I love flat shoes.
And so when you buy a pair of shoes you really like, you don't want to buy another pair in six months.
segments.cn: 所以当你买一双你真的喜欢的鞋时，你不想在六个月后再买一双。

segments.en: You want to get a pair that has a really good sole so that will last for a long time.
segments.cn: 你想要一双鞋底非常好的鞋，这样可以用很长时间。

segments.en: Right, right.
Yeah, that's true.
I think for me, yeah, that's probably one of the most important parts is the sole as long as it's comfortable.
segments.cn: 我觉得对我来说，是的，鞋底可能是最重要的部分，只要它舒适。

segments.en: Because some soles of some shoes can be very rigid.
segments.cn: 因为有些鞋子的鞋底可能非常硬。

segments.en: Yeah.
So it's a little bit uncomfortable to walk with.
segments.cn: 所以走起来有点不舒服。

segments.en: And, but I don't know, I don't really have that many pairs of shoes if I think about it.
segments.cn: 但是，我不知道，我想想我并没有那么多双鞋。

segments.en: Well, most people have one fancy pair of shoes for special occasions.
segments.cn: 好吧，大多数人都有一双特别场合穿的鞋。

segments.en: And then a pair of work shoes that are leather.
segments.cn: 然后是一双皮鞋用于工作。

segments.en: And then maybe a couple pairs of sneakers and some sandals.
segments.cn: 然后可能还有几双运动鞋和一些凉鞋。

segments.en: Sandals.
So what you have sandals and you have flip flops or are they the same?
segments.cn: 那你有凉鞋和人字拖，还是它们是一样的？

segments.en: Well, sandals is basically a kind of shoe.
segments.cn: 嗯，凉鞋基本上是一种鞋。

segments.en: It's an open shoe that you wear in the summer.
segments.cn: 它是一种夏天穿的开放式鞋。

segments.en: Flip flops are a kind of sandal.
So they usually have a V in the front.
segments.cn: 所以它们通常前面有一个V形。

segments.en: And that's where you put your your big toe in the second toe.
segments.cn: 那是你放大脚趾和第二个脚趾的地方。

segments.en: Yeah.
So you we wear them in the shower or at the beach.
segments.cn: 所以我们在淋浴或海滩上穿它们。

segments.en: They're usually made of plastic or rubber so that you can get them wet.
segments.cn: 它们通常是塑料或橡胶做的，这样你可以把它们弄湿。

segments.en: Right.
But their sandals are flip flops are a kind of sandal.
segments.cn: 但是凉鞋是人字拖的一种。

segments.en: Yeah, very good.
It's very interesting how many styles and types of shoes and actually for men.
segments.cn: 有多少种鞋子的风格和类型真的很有趣，实际上对于男性来说。

segments.en: I think it's it's not that complicated.
But when we get into women's shoes, they will see a lot of different things.
segments.cn: 但当我们谈到女性鞋子时，会看到很多不同的东西。

segments.en: There are too many styles.
I can't keep track.
All right.
So that's all the time we have for today.
segments.cn: 所以今天的时间就到这里。

segments.en: But we'll see you guys on the website if you have any questions, any doubts, or if you just want to chat with us.
segments.cn: 但如果你们有任何问题、疑虑，或者只是想和我们聊天，我们会在网站上见到你们。

segments.en: We'll see you at EnglishPod.com.
See you guys there.
All right.
Bye.
